issues.description: The problem statement text (line 50) incorrectly specifies addGuestStudents(String) while the UML in the same problem statement (lines 72-73) and the solution implementation both use addGuestStudents(int). This is a method parameter type mismatch: students reading the textual description may implement a method that takes a String which will not match the UML, the tests, or the reference solution and will cause compilation/test failures or confusion about the intended input type.
issues.suggested_fix: Fix the problem statement text to specify addGuestStudents(int) so it matches the UML and the reference solution. Alternatively, if a String parameter was intended, update the UML and the solution to use addGuestStudents(String) consistently. Prefer changing the textual description to int to preserve the numeric semantics and align with the UML and solution.

issues.description: The problem statement text (line 50) describes the method as addGuestStudents(String) while the UML (lines 72-73) and the solution implementation define addGuestStudents(int). This is an inconsistent specification of the same method's parameter type across artifacts and may lead students to implement the wrong signature (String vs int), causing confusion and failing tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement so the method signature matches the UML and solution: change the description from addGuestStudents(String) to addGuestStudents(int). This aligns the textual task with the intended implementation and reduces student confusion.
